title: Vignamato 2013 Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
description: This wine's subtle peach jam and acacia honey aromas carry over to savory palate, along with candied ginger notes. A toasted almond note marks the close.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

title: Winzer Krems 2017 Kellermeister Privat Kremser Goldberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: Green apple and pear drop on the nose reappear on the juicy easy-drinking palate, which has just a slight edge of sage savoriness. The finish is dry and refreshing.

title: Wölffer 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Long Island)
description: Aromas of papaya, lemongrass and tart candies are brimming with vibrancy on the nose. There's a solid fruit presence on the rounded palate, with a line of crisp acidity providing adequate tension.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2016 Uncaged Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This light-colored and medium-bodied wine has fresh citrus aromas, lemon, apple and vanilla flavors and a rounded texture that give it a full mouthfeel. It's well made and well-balanced.

title: Airfield Estates 2015 Hellcat Red (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is a blend of Tempranillo (81%) and Syrah. Aromas of pencil eraser, cherry, sweet herb and spice are followed by a tight core of fruit flavors with a smoky finish. Firm, lightly grainy tannins provide support.

title: Airfield Estates 2016 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)
description: The aromas jump up, with notes of lemon zest, cream and white peach that lead to rounded melon and stone fruit flavors. It brings appeal.

title: Airfield Estates 2016 Dauntless Red (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is principally Merlot (62%) and Cabernet Sauvignon (20%), with the rest pinches of Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Expressive aromas of huckleberry, jalapeño pepper, cherry and wood spice lead to sweet plump fruit flavors, with lightly grainy tannins providing support. It's enjoyable but comes off as quite green.

title: Anthony Nappa 2016 Shared Table Farm Long White Cloud Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Notes of pollen, lemon and plastic carry the nose, with a bit of melon showing on the light-bodied palate. There's mild concentration to the flavors and a pleasing roundness to the feel, balanced by a gentle vein of acidity.
designation: Shared Table Farm Long White Cloud

title: Artisan Wines DI Franz Scheider 2017 Pure Zweigelt Rosé (Burgenland)
description: The nose on this very pale rosé is rather shy but the palate presents easy notes of lemon and red currant. This is dry and easy, both very light and very refreshing.

title: Barker's Marque 2017 Arona Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A yeasty aroma is at the forefront on this wine, although there's also plenty of this style's characteristic citrus, pineapple, snow pea and green bell pepper as well. The palate is extra fruity, bright, zippy and crisp, making for an easygoing porch pounder.

title: Baron di Pauli 2016 Kinesis Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: This offers grilled herb, citrus rind and exotic fruit scents. The ripe, forward palate shows grapefruit, baked apple and mature peach flavors.

title: Bellangelo 2017 Dry Merlot Rosé (Seneca Lake)
description: Vibrant pink in color, this offers bright tones of crushed strawberry and watermelon, with a bit of tart currant. Light in body but with a pleasing roundness, this is a well-balanced summer sipper.

title: Black Cottage 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Aromas of ripe stone fruit, lemon curd and green beans are backed by appealing secondary characters of melon rind and dried herbs. The palate feels a little more forced and lacks the pretty fruit found on the nose, but there's pleasing textural weight, crisp acidity, and an interesting salty, melon rind finish.

title: Boeger 2016 Pinot Grande White Pinot Noir (El Dorado)
description: Made as a white wine from dark Pinot Noir grapes, this medium-bodied wine has earthy aromas and savory herbal flavors that give it a rustic character. It has a tartness like grapefruit on the finish.

title: BookCliff 2015 Reserve Malbec (Colorado)
description: Spicy aromas of cedar, baking spice and green peppercorn hover above notes of vanilla, blackberry and blueberry on the nose. The powdery tannins are well balanced on the straightforward palate, with more notes of cedar and pepper alongside additions of leather and raspberry. The fruit is left behind on the finish but oaky tones persist with a grip of tannins.

title: Castel Sallegg 2017 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: This wine's honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas leap out of the glass. On the fresh, linear palate, a mineral hint accompanies grapefruit, pineapple and tomato leaf notes.

title: Castellani 2016 Famiglia Castellani  (Chianti)
description: This easygoing red has subdued aromas suggesting red fruit and baking spices. The simple, light-bodied palate offers raspberry and white pepper touches alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.

title: Château Bois Malot 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This is a mineral-driven wine, still young and very textured. It has a tight character, more structure and texture than fruit at this stage, but it's sure to open up as it matures. Drink from late 2018.

title: Château la France 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This well-balanced, ripe wine has an herbal edge that contrasts comfortably with the grapefruit and apple flavors. It has a tangy texture, hinting at minerality as well as fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Château Larroque 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Attractively perfumed, this wine is ripe with kiwi and pink-grapefruit flavors. Its zesty acidity and mineral edge suggest that it will age well, certainly over the next several months. Drink from late 2018.

title: Château Paradis 2017 White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: Ripe, tropical-fruit-flavored Sauvignon Blanc dominates this soft, smooth wine. With its young fruits and flavors of lemon candy and quince, it needs a few more months to come together. Drink from early 2019.

title: Château Roubine 2017 La Vie en Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The style of this estate is for extra crisp, red-currant-flavored wine, and this attractively named bottling matches that profile. The tight acidity, crisp texture and young fruitiness suggest that it will be better in a few months when it has softened. Drink from late 2018.

title: Château Saint-Maur 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Spicy, peppery and with an herbal edge, this wine has a dense texture, rich red currant and rhubarb flavors and intense, spice at the end. It needs a few more months, so drink from late 2018.

title: Château Timberlay 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Siblings Florence and Philippe Giraud reserve 10% of their red vineyards for white wine. This is ripe, with soft, smooth creamed-pear flavors. Acidity and crispness give the wine balance. The crisp juicy fresh character is refreshing and the wine is ready to drink.

title: Columbia Winery 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: High-toned smoke, char, baking spice, berry and herb aromas are followed by plentiful currant, plum and vanilla flavors, with a crème de cassis finish. The tannins are surprisingly soft for the variety.

title: Conte Ferdinando Guicciardini 2016 Le Terre  (Chianti)
description: This straightforward wine has red cherry, iris and green peppercorn aromas that carry over to easygoing palate, along with supple tannins. Enjoy soon to catch the fruit richness.

title: Domaine Berthoumieu 2012 Tanatis Red (Vin de Liqueur)
description: This sweet, full-bodied wine made by fortifying the fermenting must with brandy is rich with jammy black fruit flavors. Its tannins are finely integrated into the structure and sweet fruit. Drink now.

title: Domaine des Diables 2017 MiP Made in Provence Classic Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Light in color, this herbal and fruity wine is perfumed and delicate. It has red-currant flavors with pink-grapefruit touches, plenty of zesty acidity and a bright aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2017 Mireille Rosé (Mediterranée)
description: Named after the owner's godmother, this unusual, perfumed blend of Syrah and Muscat is ripe with great fruitiness. Full of red berry and mango flavors, it's crisp, intense with acidity and full bodied. Drink now.

title: Duca di Saragnano 2016  Chianti
description: This opens with subtle dark-skinned berry, tilled soil and cooking spice aromas. The straightforward, easy-drinking palate offers fleshy black plum, nutmeg and white pepper hints alongside supple tannins. Drink soon.
